title: Sri Lanka’s wild elephant deaths drop in 2024
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation has reported that wild elephant deaths in the country decreased in 2024 compared to the previous year.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says cloudy skies can be expected over Southern part of the island.

title: CBSL maintains Overnight Policy Rate at current level
byline: The Monetary Policy Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to maintain the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) of the Central Bank at its current level of 8.00 per cent.

title: Inflation expected to turn positive from mid-2025: CBSL
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) says that the latest projections have indicated deeper deflation than previously projected, mainly due to the more than anticipated downward adjustment in the electricity tariff announced in January 2025.

title: Multiple people feared dead in crowd crush at India’s Kumbh Mela religious festival
byline: Multiple people were feared dead in a crowd crush at the world’s largest religious festival in India on Wednesday, as tens of millions of devotees went to bathe in a river on one of the most sacred days of the Hindu festival.

title: Suspect arrested with over 2 kg heroin in Mulleriyawa
byline: Officers of the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) have arrested a suspect along with 2 kilograms and 218 grams of heroin during a raid carried out at a residence in the Udamulla area in the Mulleriyawa police division.

title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump administration freeze on federal grants and loans
byline: A federal judge on Tuesday temporarily blocked a push from President Donald Trump to pause federal funding while his administration conducts an across-the-board ideological review to uproot progressive initiatives.

title: 13 arrested Indian fishermen remanded; 2 in hospital
byline: Thirteen Indian fishermen, who were arrested by the Sri Lanka Navy yesterday (28) for illegally entering Sri Lankan waters off Kankesanthurai, were remanded until February 10 by the Mallakam Magistrate today.

title: 2024 (2025) G.C.E O/L exam timetable released
byline: The Department of Examinations has published the timetable for the G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination 2024 (2025).

title: TRCSL to implement new software to detect and block unapproved mobile phones
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) says that a new software will be implemented to detect and block the use of unapproved mobile phones that are not registered with the TRCSL.

title: Five arrested in Jaffna with 40,000 narcotic pills
byline: The officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) have arrested five persons in possession of 40,000 narcotic pills valued at Rs. 8 million in Jaffna, police said.

title: Immigration Controller General’s bail application postponed indefinitely
byline: The Supreme Court has indefinitely postponed the bail application filed on behalf of the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, Harsha Illukpitiya, who is currently in remand custody for contempt of court.

title: Ramal Siriwardena resigns as SLTB chairman
byline: The Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), Ramal Siriwardena, has resigned from his position.

title: Indian fishermen injured due to accidental firearm discharge: SLN chief
byline: The Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy says that according to initial investigations, the two Indian fishermen who were injured when the Sri Lanka Navy apprehended an India fishing boat poaching off Kankesanthurai (KKS) have been wounded due to the accidental discharge of a firearm of a Navy personnel.

title: 3 arrested with illegally assembled vehicle in Ratnapura
byline: An illegally assembled jeep was seized, and three suspects were arrested at Angammana, Ratnapura by the Walana Anti-Vice Squad, said police.

title: Govt to discontinue ‘Chief of Defence Staff’ position
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal (Retired) Sampath Thuyacontha has stated that there is no expectation to continue the position of ‘Chief of Defence Staff’ (CDS).

title: 16 injured in head-on collision of two buses in Habarana
byline: At least 16 individuals have reportedly been injured and hospitalized following a head-on collision involving two buses near the 07th Mile Post area along the Habarana - Minneriya road.

title: Next round of UNP-SJB talks scheduled for tomorrow
byline: The third round of discussions between the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) on contesting the upcoming Local Government Election as a coalition, was held last evening (28).

title: President’s Fund to offer incentives for surgeries performed after office hours
byline: The President’s Fund has decided to provide an incentive for surgeries performed after office hours in government hospitals.

title: Sri Lanka sees increase in child pregnancies in 2024
byline: The number of adolescent pregnancies in Sri Lanka has risen to 213 in 2024, according to DIG Renuka Jayasundara, who heads the Bureau for the Investigation of Abuse of Children and Women.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna arrested
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna has been arrested this afternoon (29) by a special team of police officers in Jaffna, over allegedly obstructing the duties of police personnel in Anuradhapura.

title: DMT introduces WhatsApp number for complaints and appeals
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has introduced a WhatsApp number (071 4033300) for the general public to submit written complaints and appeals to the Commissioner General of Motor Traffic.

title: Governor Hanif Yusoof denies allegations over containers at port
byline: Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof has denied allegations leveled against him with regard to the release of containers from the port without inspection.

title: Dozens killed in stampede at India’s massive Maha Kumbh Mela festival
byline: Dozens of people were killed in a pre-dawn stampede at the Maha Kumbh Mela in northern India on Jan 29, as tens of millions gathered to take a dip in sacred river waters on the most auspicious day of a six-week Hindu festival.

title: Sri Lanka Customs issues clarification on controversial containers released
byline: Issuing a clarification regarding the controversy over containers released recently, Sri Lanka Customs says that there were no cargo designated to Expolanka Holdings among the 323 containers released without inspections.

title: Police officer arrested for drunk driving after collision in Ratmalana
byline: A police officer has been arrested for causing an accident while driving under the influence of alcohol near the Belek Kade Junction in Ratmalana.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna granted bail
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna who was arrested by police in Jaffna for allegedly obstructing the duties of police personnel in Anuradhapura has been granted bail by the Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court.
